```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
library(DBI)
library(duckdb)

# Connect to the database
con <- DBI::dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), dbdir = "my-db.duckdb")

# Write the penguins table to the database
DBI::dbWriteTable(con, "penguins", palmerpenguins::penguins, overwrite = TRUE)
df <- dplyr::tbl(con, "penguins")

# Summary statistics by species and sex
df %>%
  group_by(species, sex) %>%
  summarise(
    across(
      ends_with("mm") | ends_with("g"),
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
    )
  ) %>%
  dplyr::collect() %>%
  knitr::kable()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`summarise()` has grouped output by "species". You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}


|species   |sex    | bill_length_mm| bill_depth_mm| flipper_length_mm| body_mass_g|
|:---------|:------|--------------:|-------------:|-----------------:|-----------:|
|Adelie    |NA     |       37.84000|      18.32000|          185.6000|    3540.000|
|Adelie    |female |       37.25753|      17.62192|          187.7945|    3368.836|
|Adelie    |male   |       40.39041|      19.07260|          192.4110|    4043.493|
|Chinstrap |female |       46.57353|      17.58824|          191.7353|    3527.206|
|Chinstrap |male   |       51.09412|      19.25294|          199.9118|    3938.971|
|Gentoo    |NA     |       45.62500|      14.55000|          215.7500|    4587.500|
|Gentoo    |female |       45.56379|      14.23793|          212.7069|    4679.741|
|Gentoo    |male   |       49.47377|      15.71803|          221.5410|    5484.836|

```{.r .cell-code}
# Scatter plot with linear regression
df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}


```{.r .cell-code}
# Distribution of flipper length
df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = flipper_length_mm)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "blue", color = "black") +
  facet_wrap(~species)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
# Box plots for body mass by species and sex
df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = species, y = body_mass_g, fill = sex)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Body Mass by Species and Sex")
```
